Detailed Description

This class implements the node of the DBMTree.

The DBMTree node...

The structure of DBNode follows:

node structure

The Header holds the information about the node itself.

  • Occupation: Number of entries in this node.

The Entry holds the information of the link to the other node.

  • PageID: The identifier of the page which holds the root of the sub tree.
    • Distance: The distance of this object from the representative object.
    • NEntries: Number of objects in the sub tree.
    • Radius: Radius of the sub tree.
    • Offset: The offset of the object in the page. DO NOT MODIFY ITS VALUE.

The Object is an array of bytes that holds the information required to rebuild the original object.

Version
1.0
Author
Marcos Rodrigues Vieira (mrvie.nosp@m.ira@.nosp@m.icmc..nosp@m.usp..nosp@m.br)

typedef struct stDBMNode::stDBMEntry stDBMNode::stDBMEntry

This type represents a DBMTree node entry.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

stDBMNode::stDBMNode ( stPage *  page,
bool  create = false 
)
inline

Creates a new instance of this class. The parameter page is an instance of stPage that hold the node data.

The parameter create tells to stPage what operation will be performed. True means that the page will be initialized and false means that the page will be used as it is. The default value is false.

Parameters
pageThe page that hold the data of this node.
createThe operation to be performed.

Definition at line 176 of file stDBMNode.h.

Member Function Documentation

int stDBMNode::AddEntry ( stSize  size,
const stByte *  object,
stPageID  subTree 
)

Adds a new entry to this node. This method will return the idx of the new node or a negative value for failure.

This method will fail if there is not enough space to hold the new object.

If you have added a new entry successfully, you may edit the entry fields using the method GetEntry().

Parameters
sizeThe size of the object in bytes.
objectThe object data.
Warning
The parameter size is not verified by this implementation unless stDEBUG is defined at compile time.
Returns
The position in the vector Entries.
See also
RemoveEntry()
GetEntry()

inline

Returns the reference of the desired entry. You may use this method to read and modify the entry information.

Warning
